content: from *the court crochet doyley book* by mrs eliza warren published by ackerman & co in 1847 picture on page 2 of the pdf pattern pages 10-14 5-9 of the original thread called for is raworth s crochet thread no 30 which may or may not correspond to a modern size 30 no hook size is suggested and no finished dimensions are listed while the design itself is not difficult it is a very old one and not all terms used are the modern ones however the stitches are clearly explained in the text additionally the pattern as written calls for breaking the thread and starting over after every round but an experienced doily maker may climb out using the usual techniques note that the new round does not always start where the old round ends so this does require strong pattern-reading abilities recommended for experienced crocheters or those looking for an interesting challenge
